content: You will next receive a multiple-choice question, each with five options: A, B, C, D, and E respectively. Please provide your answer as a single letter option (your response should contain only one letter as the answer and no other text).(Notice that the answer result should remain the same for the same question, even if the order of the options is rearranged.)

Question: The juror was quite bored and zoning out but wanted to convey he was hearing testimony, so he just sat there doing what?
Options: A. take notes B. nodding C. change of heart D. writing down E. listening

The juror was quite bored and zoning out but wanted to convey he was hearing testimony, so he just sat there doing listening. Listening is the action of actively receiving and understanding sound information, which is what the juror was trying to do. Taking notes, nodding, changing heart and writing down are actions that do not accurately reflect the juror’s desire to convey that he was still actively participating in the trial. So, the answer is E. listening.

Question: The juror was quite bored and zoning out but wanted to convey he was hearing testimony, so he just sat there doing what?
Options: E. listening D. writing down C. change of heart B. nodding A. take notes
在你提供的答案中，只有“E. listening”（倾听）符合问题的描述，即那个无聊的陪审员虽然想要传达他在听取证词的信息，但只是简单地坐着倾听，没有其他的行动或表述。因此，正确答案是E. listening。
